L2_gloss: denotes a movement towards the speaker
denotes a movement towards the subject
Used to give the ingressive aspect to verbs
to be going to buy, ngâ hāi ― I am going to buy that
Used to give the prospective aspect to verbs
Xichang (a county-level city in Liangshan prefecture, Sichuan, China)
Used to give the premeditated aspect to verbs
to be going to do, ngâ mwĭ ― I am going to do that
negates the verb, dzìh mâyĭnggă ― not be able to eat
used to denote the successful accomplishment of a verb
Used to form adverbs of adjectives.
Used to give the experiential aspect to verbs
used to denote short duration of a verb
Shimian County (county in Sichuan province, China)

Used to form nouns denoting people that perform the action of the suffixed verb.
‎nkhvĭh (“to steal”) + ‎-sû → ‎nkhvĭhsû (“thief”)
Used to give the progressive aspect to verbs
Used to form plurals of nouns.
denotes a motion away from the subject
reflexive pronoun: myself, yourself, ourselves etc.
